Melanoma: Melanoma is a serious form of skin cancer that begins in cells known as melanocytes.
Melanocytic nevus: Commonly known as moles, usually benign.
Basal cell carcinoma: Most common type of skin cancer, rarely spreads.
Actinic keratosis: Precancerous skin condition caused by sun damage.
Benign keratosis: Non-cancerous skin growths that may look like melanoma.
